title: Epic: Custom Provider
description: User-defined OpenAI-compatible provider. Allows connecting to any API endpoint (e.g., ProxyPal at localhost:8317). Dynamic model fetching.

title: Create CustomProvider implementation
description: Implement AIProvider for user-defined OpenAI-compatible API endpoints
design:
Create lib/services/providers/custom_provider.dart:
- Extends AIProvider
- baseUrl: user-defined (e.g., http://localhost:8317)
- Auth: optional Bearer token
- Endpoint: /v1/chat/completions (OpenAI-compatible)
- Dynamic model fetching from /v1/models
- No hardcoded models (empty in ModelRegistry)
- ~100 lines
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] requiresApiKey returns false (optional)
- [ ] configure() accepts custom baseUrl
- [ ] testConnection() validates server reachability
- [ ] getAvailableModels() fetches dynamically from /v1/models
- [ ] chat() and chatStream() work with any OpenAI-compatible API
- [ ] Works with ProxyPal at localhost:8317
- [ ] Graceful fallback if /v1/models not available

title: Epic: Local Providers Migration
description: Migrate existing Ollama and LM Studio providers to new abstraction layer. Backward compatible - existing users should not need reconfiguration.

title: Create OllamaProvider implementation
description: Implement AIProvider for Ollama local server
design:
Create lib/services/providers/ollama_provider.dart:
- Extends AIProvider
- Default baseUrl: http://localhost:11434
- No auth required
- Endpoints: /api/chat (chat), /api/tags (list models)
- Parse Ollama-specific response format
- Support streaming via Server-Sent Events
- ~150 lines
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Implements all AIProvider methods
- [ ] testConnection() validates server reachability
- [ ] getAvailableModels() fetches from /api/tags
- [ ] chat() returns complete response
- [ ] chatStream() yields incremental tokens
- [ ] Handles connection errors gracefully
- [ ] Respects timeout settings (5s test, 60s chat)
close_reason: Completed OllamaProvider implementing AIProvider. Implements all methods: testConnection() (5s timeout), getAvailableModels() fetches from /api/tags, chat() returns complete response, chatStream() yields tokens via SSE. Handles connection errors, timeouts, model not found. Default baseUrl: http://localhost:11434, no auth required.

title: Create LMStudioProvider implementation
description: Implement AIProvider for LM Studio local server (OpenAI-compatible)
design:
Create lib/services/providers/lm_studio_provider.dart:
- Extends AIProvider
- Default baseUrl: http://localhost:1234
- No auth required
- OpenAI-compatible endpoint: /v1/chat/completions
- Uses standard OpenAI request/response format
- Support streaming via SSE
- ~120 lines
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Implements all AIProvider methods
- [ ] Uses OpenAI-compatible /v1/chat/completions endpoint
- [ ] testConnection() validates server reachability
- [ ] getAvailableModels() fetches from /v1/models
- [ ] chat() returns complete response
- [ ] chatStream() yields incremental tokens
- [ ] Handles connection errors gracefully

title: Update AIService with factory pattern
description: Refactor AIService to use factory pattern for provider instantiation
design:
Modify lib/services/ai_service.dart:
- Add createProvider(AIProviderType) factory method
- Maintain backward compatibility with existing API
- Delegate to appropriate provider implementation
- Cache provider instances
- Handle provider switching at runtime
- ~100 lines changes
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] createProvider() returns correct provider for each type
- [ ] Existing public API unchanged (backward compat)
- [ ] Provider instances are cached
- [ ] Can switch providers at runtime without restart
- [ ] All existing tests pass
- [ ] No breaking changes to dependent code

title: Epic: Abstraction Layer
description: Foundation layer for multi-provider AI integration. Creates abstract interface (AIProvider) and hardcoded model registry. Must complete before all other work.

title: Create AIProvider abstract interface
description: Create abstract AIProvider class with core methods for all providers
design:
Create lib/services/ai_provider.dart with:
- AIProviderType enum (ollama, lmStudio, openai, gemini, deepseek, zhipu, custom)
- AIProviderError enum (connectionFailed, authenticationFailed, rateLimited, modelNotFound, timeout, unknown)
- Abstract AIProvider class:
  * Properties: name, displayName, isCloud, requiresApiKey
  * void configure({required String baseUrl, String? apiKey})
  * Future<AIProviderError?> testConnection()
  * Future<List<String>> getAvailableModels()
  * Future<String> chat(String prompt, String model, {Map<String,dynamic>? options, Duration? timeout})
  * Stream<String> chatStream(String prompt, String model, {Map<String,dynamic>? options, Duration? timeout})
- ~50 lines
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] AIProviderType enum has all 7 provider types
- [ ] AIProviderError enum has all 6 error types
- [ ] AIProvider abstract class compiles without errors
- [ ] All methods have correct signatures per design doc
- [ ] configure() accepts baseUrl and optional apiKey
- [ ] testConnection() returns AIProviderError? (null on success)
close_reason: Completed AIProvider abstract interface with AIProviderType enum (7 types), AIProviderError enum (6 types), and abstract AIProvider class with all required methods (configure, testConnection, getAvailableModels, chat, chatStream). All acceptance criteria met.

title: Create ModelRegistry with hardcoded models
description: Create ModelRegistry class with hardcoded model lists for cloud providers
design:
Create lib/services/model_registry.dart with:
- ModelInfo class (id, displayName, recommended flag)
- ModelRegistry class with static const Map<String, List<ModelInfo>>
- Models for: openai (gpt-5.2, gpt-5.2-pro, gpt-5-mini, gpt-4.1), gemini (gemini-3-flash, gemini-3-pro, gemini-2.5-flash, gemini-2.5-pro), deepseek (deepseek-chat, deepseek-reasoner), zhipu (glm-4.7, glm-4.6)
- ~80 lines
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] ModelInfo class has id, displayName, recommended fields
- [ ] ModelRegistry contains all 4 cloud provider model lists
- [ ] Each provider has at least one recommended model
- [ ] No runtime errors on model access
- [ ] Empty list for custom provider (dynamic fetch)
close_reason: Completed ModelRegistry with ModelInfo class (id, displayName, recommended) and hardcoded models for all 4 cloud providers (openai: 4 models, gemini: 4 models, deepseek: 2 models, zhipu: 2 models). Empty lists for local/custom providers. Helper methods: getRecommended(), isDynamicProvider(), getModelIds().

title: Epic: Cloud Providers
description: Implement cloud AI providers: OpenAI, Gemini, DeepSeek, Zhipu. Each uses different auth patterns. Support streaming and non-streaming chat.

title: Create OpenAIProvider implementation
description: Implement AIProvider for OpenAI cloud API
design:
Create lib/services/providers/openai_provider.dart:
- Extends AIProvider
- baseUrl: https://api.openai.com
- Auth: Bearer token in Authorization header
- Endpoint: /v1/chat/completions
- Models from ModelRegistry (gpt-5.2, gpt-5.2-pro, gpt-5-mini, gpt-4.1)
- Support streaming via SSE
- ~120 lines
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] requiresApiKey returns true
- [ ] configure() stores API key securely
- [ ] testConnection() validates API key (401 = auth failed)
- [ ] chat() uses models from ModelRegistry
- [ ] chatStream() yields incremental tokens
- [ ] Handles rate limiting (429) with retry
- [ ] Proper error mapping to AIProviderError

title: Create GeminiProvider implementation
description: Implement AIProvider for Google Gemini API (different auth pattern)
design:
Create lib/services/providers/gemini_provider.dart:
- Extends AIProvider
- baseUrl: https://generativelanguage.googleapis.com
- Auth: API key in query parameter (?key=xxx) NOT header
- Endpoint: /v1beta/models/{model}:generateContent
- Different request/response format from OpenAI
- Models from ModelRegistry (gemini-3-flash, gemini-3-pro, gemini-2.5-*)
- ~150 lines (extra for format conversion)
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] requiresApiKey returns true
- [ ] Auth uses query param, not Authorization header
- [ ] testConnection() validates API key
- [ ] Request body converted to Gemini format
- [ ] Response parsed from Gemini format
- [ ] chatStream() handles Gemini streaming format
- [ ] Proper error mapping to AIProviderError

title: Create DeepSeekProvider implementation
description: Implement AIProvider for DeepSeek cloud API (OpenAI-compatible)
design:
Create lib/services/providers/deepseek_provider.dart:
- Extends AIProvider
- baseUrl: https://api.deepseek.com
- Auth: Bearer token in Authorization header
- Endpoint: /v1/chat/completions (OpenAI-compatible)
- Models from ModelRegistry (deepseek-chat, deepseek-reasoner)
- ~120 lines
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] requiresApiKey returns true
- [ ] Uses OpenAI-compatible endpoint format
- [ ] testConnection() validates API key
- [ ] chat() returns complete response
- [ ] chatStream() yields incremental tokens
- [ ] Handles DeepSeek-specific errors
- [ ] Proper error mapping to AIProviderError

title: Create ZhipuProvider implementation
description: Implement AIProvider for Zhipu (Z.AI) cloud API
design:
Create lib/services/providers/zhipu_provider.dart:
- Extends AIProvider
- baseUrl: https://open.bigmodel.cn/api/paas
- Auth: Bearer token in Authorization header
- Endpoint: /v4/chat/completions
- Models from ModelRegistry (glm-4.7, glm-4.6)
- ~120 lines
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] requiresApiKey returns true
- [ ] Uses Zhipu v4 API endpoint
- [ ] testConnection() validates API key
- [ ] chat() returns complete response
- [ ] chatStream() yields incremental tokens
- [ ] Handles Zhipu-specific errors
- [ ] Proper error mapping to AIProviderError

title: Epic: Settings UI
description: Update settings screen with grouped provider layout (Local/Cloud/Custom). Secure API key storage via flutter_secure_storage. Connection testing UI.

title: Update ConfigProvider with secure API key storage
description: Add secure API key storage using flutter_secure_storage
design:
Modify lib/ui/theme/config_provider.dart:
- Add flutter_secure_storage dependency to pubspec.yaml
- Add fields: openaiApiKey, geminiApiKey, deepseekApiKey, zhipuApiKey, customUrl, customApiKey
- Encrypt API keys with AES-256 (platform keychain/keystore)
- Add getters/setters for each field
- Persist securely, NOT in plain SharedPreferences
- ~80 lines changes
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] flutter_secure_storage added to pubspec.yaml
- [ ] All 4 cloud provider API keys storable
- [ ] Custom URL and optional key storable
- [ ] Keys encrypted on disk (verify no plaintext)
- [ ] Migration from any existing plain storage
- [ ] Clear keys on logout/reset
- [ ] No API keys in logs or debug output

title: Update SettingsScreen with grouped provider layout
description: Redesign settings UI with Local/Cloud/Custom provider groups
design:
Modify lib/ui/screens/settings_screen.dart:
- Group 1: LOCAL PROVIDERS (Ollama, LM Studio) with URL config
- Group 2: CLOUD PROVIDERS (OpenAI, Gemini, DeepSeek, Zhipu) with API key inputs
- Group 3: CUSTOM PROVIDER with URL + optional key
- Radio button selection for active provider
- Test Connection button for each provider
- Model dropdown that updates based on selected provider
- Success/error feedback on connection test
- ~200 lines changes
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Three collapsible sections (Local/Cloud/Custom)
- [ ] Radio buttons for provider selection
- [ ] API key inputs with obscured text
- [ ] Edit button for local provider URLs
- [ ] Test Connection button shows success/error within 5s
- [ ] Model dropdown populates after successful connection
- [ ] Save Settings persists all config
- [ ] UI matches design mockup in plan

title: Epic: Testing
description: Unit tests with MockAIProvider, integration tests with VCR pattern. Verify backward compatibility for existing users. Test all error handling paths.

title: Create unit tests for all providers
description: Unit tests with MockAIProvider for all provider implementations
design:
Create test/services/providers/ directory:
- mock_ai_provider.dart - MockAIProvider for testing
- ollama_provider_test.dart
- lm_studio_provider_test.dart
- openai_provider_test.dart
- gemini_provider_test.dart
- deepseek_provider_test.dart
- zhipu_provider_test.dart
- custom_provider_test.dart
- Test all error handling paths (connection, auth, rate limit, timeout)
- Test retry logic with simulated failures
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] MockAIProvider can simulate all error types
- [ ] Each provider has dedicated test file
- [ ] testConnection() tested for success and all failure modes
- [ ] chat() tested with mock responses
- [ ] chatStream() tested with incremental tokens
- [ ] Retry logic tested (3 retries, exponential backoff)
- [ ] All tests pass with flutter test

title: Create integration tests with VCR pattern
description: Integration tests using recorded responses for cloud providers
design:
Create test/integration/:
- Use VCR pattern (recorded API responses) for reproducible tests
- Record actual API responses once, replay in CI
- Add --mock flag for development mode
- Test actual HTTP request/response cycle
- Verify request format matches provider expectations
- test/fixtures/ for recorded responses
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] VCR recording/playback infrastructure in place
- [ ] Recorded responses for each cloud provider
- [ ] Tests pass offline using recorded fixtures
- [ ] --mock flag skips real API calls
- [ ] Request format verified against provider specs
- [ ] Response parsing verified for each provider

title: Test backward compatibility for existing users
description: Verify existing Ollama/LM Studio users can upgrade without reconfiguration
design:
Create test/migration/:
- Simulate v2.0.2 user with Ollama configured
- Upgrade to new version
- Verify settings preserved
- Verify app functions without reconfiguration
- Test edge cases: partial config, corrupted storage
- Document migration path
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Existing Ollama settings preserved after upgrade
- [ ] Existing LM Studio settings preserved
- [ ] App launches without configuration dialog
- [ ] Translation works immediately after upgrade
- [ ] No data loss during migration
- [ ] Matches acceptance scenario in plan:
  - Given existing user with Ollama configured
  - When app upgrades to new version
  - Then Ollama settings preserved
  - And app functions without reconfiguration
